column4: Ugh, Linux is a pain, I should just switch back to windows, everything worked flawlessly there
In Linux, I get the error "Xlib:  extension "XFree86-DRI" missing on display ":1.0""
I didn't even have to do anything in wndows, I might as well switch back
The proprietary ATI drivers, installed using envy
I have an ATI200m radeon graphics card
why didn't you use the Restricted Drivers Manager?
